title: Risotto
summary: Risotto (/rɪˈzɒtoʊ/, Italian: [riˈsɔtto, -ˈzɔt-], from riso meaning "rice")[1] is a northern Italian rice dish cooked with broth until it reaches a creamy consistency. The broth can be derived from meat, fish, or vegetables. Many types of risotto contain butter, onion, white wine, and parmesan cheese. It is one of the most common ways of cooking rice in Italy. Saffron was originally used for flavour and its signature yellow colour.[2][3]
